If the boiling points of two solvents \(X\) and \(Y\) (having same molecular weights) are in the ratio \(2: 1\) and their enthalpy of vaporizations are in the ratio \(1: 2\), then the boiling point elevation constant of \(X\) is \(m\) times the boiling point elevation constant of \(Y\). The value of \(m\) is (nearest integer) [8 Apr 2023 shift 2]

(E) A negatively charged sol is obtained when KI solution is added to silver nitrate solution.

1.q_string: At \(35^{\circ} C\), the vapour pressure of \(CS _2\) is \(512 mmHg\) and that of acetone is \(344 mmH g\). A solution of \(CS _2\) in acctone has a total vapour pressure of \(600 mmH\). The false statement amongst the following is: [7 jan 2020 Shift 1]

q_option: the volume of the solution increases and the volume of the solvent decreases
the volume of the solution decreases and the volume of the solvent increases
the volume of the solution and the solvent does not change
the volume of the solution does not change and the volume of the solvent decreases
